dt: {bc}having qualities appropriate to or usually associated with a man
{bc}of, relating to, or constituting the gender that ordinarily includes most words or grammatical forms referring to males
{bc}having or occurring in a stressed final syllable
{bc}having the final {d_link|chord|chord:1} occurring on a strong beat

et: Middle English {it}masculin{/it}, from Latin {it}masculinus{/it}, from {it}masculus{/it}, noun, male, diminutive of {it}mas{/it} male
shortdef: having qualities appropriate to or usually associated with a man
of, relating to, or constituting the gender that ordinarily includes most words or grammatical forms referring to males

dt: {bc}the quality or nature of the male sex {bc}the quality, state, or degree of being {d_link|masculine|masculine:1} or manly

dt.t: challenging traditional notions about {wi}masculinity{/wi} and femininity
… a style which alternates between a polished grace and blunt {wi}masculinity{/wi}.

shortdef: the quality or nature of the male sex : the quality, state, or degree of being masculine or manly
